name: rolify
body:
**Very simple Role management library without any authorization enforcement supporting scope on resource object (class checking and resource checking).**

Letâ€™s see an example:

```ruby
> user.has_role?(:moderator, Forum.first)
=> false # if user is moderator of another Forum
```
This library is generic enough to be used by any authentication/authorization solutions. Look at his [Tutorial](https://github.com/EppO/rolify/wiki/Tutorial) if you want to checkout an example showing how to integrate [rolify](https://github.com/EppO/rolify) with [CanCan](https://github.com/ryanb/cancan) and [Devise](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise).

## Dependencies

* >= Rails 3.1
* ActiveRecord or Mongoid ORMs

## Installation

In Rails 3, add this to your Gemfile and run the bundle command:

```ruby
   gem 'rolify'
```

Alternatively, you can install it as a plugin:

```
$ rails plugin install git://github.com/EppO/rolify.git
```
